Description: Model axe-head: made of sheet metal. It has slightly convex sides and butt and a deeply-rounded cutting end. Traced in the surface of one face is a representation of a scarab-beetle holding sun-discs between its front and rear legs, possibly a modern addition. Both faces are lightly corroded.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (13)
